questions.question_text_1: Suppose a fair die is thrown twice independently. Let a random variable X denote the number obtained on the first die and a random variable Y denote the number obtained on the second die. Define Z =| 7 − X − Y |.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: At a particular petrol pump, petrol is stocked in a bulk tank each week. Let a random variable X denote the proportion of the tank’s capacity that is stocked in a given week, and let Y denote the proportion of the tank’s capacity that is sold in the same week. The petrol pump cannot sell more than what was stocked in a given week. Assume the joint density function of X and Y is given by
